headline: Lumen narrows loss, lifts free cash flow forecast on tax savings
summary: (Reuters) -Lumen Technologies on Thursday reported a smaller-than-expected second-quarter loss and raised its full-year free cash flow forecast by more than 60%, helped by cost savings from President Trump's tax cut legislation.  Lumen now expects 2025 free cash flow between $1.2 billion and $1.4 billion, up from a prior range of $700 million to $900 million.  "We're taking it up considerably because of strong performance, but also because of the new tax bill, that definitely benefited us and that allows us to invest," CFO Chris Stansbury told Reuters in an interview.

headline: AT&T to dual list on NYSE Texas in latest win for new exchange
summary: The dual listing of the Dallas-headquartered company, which has nearly 24,000 employees based in Texas, will be effective Friday, August 1.  The state is also home to the largest number of companies listed on the NYSE.  AT&T will maintain its primary listing on the New York Stock Exchange and trade with the "T" ticker symbol on NYSE Texas.

headline: AT&T Announces Dual Listing on NYSE Texas
summary: AT&T (NYSE:T) announced today the dual listing of its common stock on NYSE Texas, the newly launched fully electronic equities exchange headquartered in Dallas, Texas, effective Aug. 1, 2025.
